intro: Hieracium canum subsp. arenicola, commonly known as the sand thistle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. This subspecies typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in coastal or arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster. The plant is adapted to withstand harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitats.
